page.title: 04BOHEMIA
page.content: This area has one farm, called Bohemia. To the north of the farm is a district referred to on the ordnance map as Bohemia. The farm is occupied, and the land is mainly arable with some grazing land. The area is dissected by a local traffic road running from north-west to south-east. The road eventually joins up further south with another minor road leading from Wigginton to Shipton, and in the north peters out into a narrow farm track. This track appeared to be overgrown and showed little sign of use, apart from ruts made by farm vehicles and implements. A stream running from east to west, is crossed by a single lane bridge called Bull Lane Bridge.The stream runs in the bottom of a deep ditch, which showed signs of having been dredged and deepened at some time
